content:
Are people working on the 2021 survey? I'd love to give some feedback on previous years, if possible (and/or help out if there is a need for more hands).

AIUI, the raw data for previous years is kept confidential for privacy reasons. Is there public access to summary statistics which are a bit more comprehensive than the blog post? The blog post is very cherry-picked and doesn't give a good overall picture of user sentiment.

@Nick Cameron the survey last year was mostly done by @nikomatsakis and myself (with the help of an a third party for aggregating statistics paid for by Mozilla).

We have not yet started the next survey, but that should happen soon. We do have more detailed analysis that I wouldn’t call public, but perhaps it could be shared on a more limited basis.
@nikomatsakis shall we create a new Zulip channel for this year’s survey?
Thanks @rylev I’d definitely be keen to get hold of that data if possible. And like I said, I’m happy to help out with this years survey
creating a new stream seems like a good idea
it's a good thought to start now
last year we did it kind of rushed and didn't have time to incorporate prior years' feedback
I agree with @Nick Cameron that we should be willing to export more summary data-- as an example, some folks were asking for more details about IDE users and things last year
(and I recently got a request to give out the "source data" for the charts in the blog post, for example, which seems definitely harmless)
If anyone's interested in helping, visit #t-community/rust-survey-2021
